title: Stressed tourist goes on airport rampage after missing flight because he was drinking

A stressed tourist has gone on a furious rampage at an airport after missing his flight because he was drinking in the departure lounge bar.

The man's frustration was caught on video as he tried and failed to get through a locked door leading to the runway at Moscow's Sheremetyevo International Airport.

CCTV footage shows him angrily high kicking at rope barriers at the airport, before losing his balance and falling onto his back.

Not to be put off, he then ducks under the barriers and begins trying to destroy computer monitors behind the check-in desk, before attempting to throw a plugged in keyboard onto the floor.

(Image: Anna Liesowska /east2west news)

(Image: Metromost; EAST2WEST NEWS)

Although his fellow passengers appear completely unconcerned by his actions, the man was spotted by airport security who try and calm him as he continues to attack computer monitors.

However, the man will not be distracted from his rampage, and returns to the desk to empty out the contexts of a drawer onto the ground.

(Image: Anna Liesowska /east2west news)

(Image: Anna Liesowska /east2west news)

In response, the security guard drags him away before spinning him 180 degrees and slamming him onto the ground.

A spokesman for the airport said: "Due to the quick reaction of the airport security service, the intrusion was halted."

(Image: Anna Liesowska /east2west news)

(Image: Anna Liesowska /east2west news)

The unnamed man was hauled off to the airport police station and charged with hooliganism.

In May, Sheremetyevo International Airport was the site of a disaster after an Aeroflot aircraft was struck by lightning soon after take-off.

The plane was ravaged by flames and crash landed in the incident on May 5, which killed 41 people.
description: The furious passenger started throwing around computer equipment at Moscow's Sheremetyevo International Airport
